trans-unit.source: Represents a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TextBox"></xref> control that is hosted in a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTextBoxColumn"></xref>.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTextBox> and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTextBoxColumn> work together so that users can directly edit values in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGrid> control column.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTextBoxColumn> derives from <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridColumnStyle>, and is designed to host the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTextBox>, which derives from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox> control.

In addition to the properties, events, and methods of the base control, you can call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.KeyPress> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.KeyDown> events with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.OnKeyPress%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.OnMouseDown%2A> methods.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTextBox"></xref> class.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTextBox"></xref> is in a mode that allows either editing or navigating.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTextBox.IsInEditOrNavigateMode%2A> property is used within the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ProcessKeyMessage%2A> to determine how to process key press events, to check the state of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTextBox>.
For example, if one of the navigation (arrow) keys is pressed, the appropriate action for the state of the control must occur.
`true` if the controls is in navigation mode, and editing has not begun; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `true`.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.KeyPress"></xref> event.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.KeyPressEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.MouseWheel"></xref> event.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MouseEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Indicates whether the key pressed is processed further (for example, to navigate, or escape).
This property is read-only.
This method is called when a control receives a keyboard message.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Message"></xref>, passed by reference, that contains the key data.
`true` if the key is consumed, `false` to if the key is further processed.
Sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGrid"></xref> to which this <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TextBox"></xref> control belongs.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGrid"></xref> control that hosts the control.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.WndProc(System.Windows.Forms.Message@)"></xref> event.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Message"></xref> that contains the event data.
